page.title: 06History (3)
page.content: In 1757 the River Blyth Navigation was formed, and although only a small section of the river is within the survey area to the north-east, it also includes the Bramfield Brook which was navigable to wherries as far as a quay at Church Farm, Thorington. This was used for grain, hay and flints. There is no record of this being used after 1810. The narrow guage Halesworth to Southwold Railway was opened in 1879 and closed 50 years later. The roads were not metalled until after the Great War of 1914-1918, and the minor roads remained under gravel until 1935.
